turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Band of the Brigade of Gurkhas.
turn.1: What is the difference between a Gurkha and a British soldier?
turn.2: Band of the Brigade of Gurkhas The Band of the Brigade of Gurkhas is a British military band based at Shorncliffe.
turn.4: It supports the British Army's Brigade of Gurkhas in ceremonial settings and represents the brigade by performing at musical events.
turn.5: What is the band's ranking system?
turn.6: It is a directly reporting unit of the Corps of Army Music (CAMUS), which sponsors the promotion of British military music.
turn.7: How many members are in the band?
turn.8: It is one of two 35 member wind bands in the CAMUS. (the other being the Band and Bugles of The Rifles).
turn.10: The band has travelled extensively since its inception, travelling more recently to Australia, Brunei, Canada, France, Germany, Nepal, Belgium.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Today, musicians are recruited when they complete basic military training, with musical instruction commencing first under Director of Music (DOM) and then under supervision of the Royal Military School of Music.
